metadata.purpose: Complete essay structure templates for B2 Cambridge essays
metadata.source: PowerPoint slide structures by Majid Inashtar26
metadata.usage: These structures should guide the IDEAS JSON file creation

introduction.label: Introduction (Section A)
introduction.purpose: Introduce topic and present both sides
phrases: Few people would deny that [topic] has become an essential part of daily life.
In recent times, [topic] has sparked considerable debate due to...
It is widely recognised that [topic] plays a crucial role in shaping society.
There is a growing recognition that [topic] can have both positive and negative effects.
Over the past few years, there has been a significant increase in the use of [topic].
It is commonly accepted that [topic] results from several key factors.
[Topic] has indisputably become inseparable from our everyday activities.

arguments_for.label: Arguments (Section A - Advantages)
phrases: The main advantage of [topic] is that it...
• One major benefit of [topic] is that it...
• A further positive aspect of [topic] is that it...
The main argument in favour of [topic] is that it...
• A key reason why many people support [topic] is because...
• Supporters of [topic] often point out that it...
One benefit of [topic] is the fact that it...
• Another strong point is that [topic] helps to...
• A clear advantage of [topic] lies in its ability to...

arguments_against.label: Arguments (Section B - Disadvantages)
phrases: Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks of [topic].
Hence, it is vitally important to consider the advantages and disadvantages of [topic].
Consequently, it is essential that we study the arguments in favour of and against [topic].
Thus, it becomes necessary to evaluate whether the advantages of [topic] outweigh its disadvantages.
While there are many advantages to [topic], it is also true that...
• Although [topic] offers certain benefits, it also presents challenges.
• Despite its positive side, [topic] can cause some difficulties.
The key disadvantage of [topic] is that it...
• A major drawback of [topic] is that it...
• One clear limitation of [topic] is that it...
• This solution/drawback of [topic] is that it may...
• One negative aspect of [topic] is that it tends to...
• A significant downside of [topic] is the risk of...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
phrases: In conclusion, as far as I'm concerned, there are both advantages and disadvantages to [topic].
On balance, it seems that the benefits of [topic] outweigh the drawbacks, despite all the...
To sum up, as far as I can judge, while [topic] has its negative aspects, its advantages are more significant.
Overall, in all certainty [topic] can be seen as both beneficial and problematic in different ways.

introduction.label: Introduction (Section A)
introduction.purpose: Introduce the issue and its significance
phrases: Nowadays/These days, the issue of [topic] has become increasingly significant.
It is widely acknowledged that [topic] has led to a number of serious consequences.
In recent years, [topic] has emerged as one of the main causes of [effect].
It is generally accepted that [topic] results from several key factors.
Few people would deny that [topic] has produced both positive and negative outcomes.
There is growing concern about the causes and the consequences of [topic].
Recent studies indicate that [topic] is closely linked to [effect].

causes.label: Arguments (Section A - Causes)
phrases: One of the main causes of [issue] is...
• A major reason behind [issue] is...
• The primary factor leading to [issue] is...
This problem largely results from...
The situation can be attributed to...
[Issue] stems mainly from...
Another important cause of [issue] concerns...
• A further contributing factor is...
• Another reason for [issue] lies in...

effects.label: Arguments (Section B - Effects)
phrases: Hence, it is vital to examine the main causes of [topic] and its resulting effects.
Therefore, this essay will explore the key factors leading to [topic] and analyse their consequences.
Consequently, it is important to consider both the causes and effects of [topic].
Therefore, understanding what leads to [topic] and what outcomes it produces is essential.
As a result, [effect] has become increasingly common.
• Consequently, this has led to [effect].
• This in turn causes [effect].
The impact of [cause] can be seen in [effect].
One major effect of [cause] is that it...
• As a consequence of [cause], many people now...
This has had a significant influence on [group/area].
The outcome of this trend is evident in [effect].
Such causes have produced noticeable changes in [subject].

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Emphasize the connection between causes and effects
phrases: To sum up, it is clear that [cause] has led to [effect] in many ways.
Overall, both social and economic factors contribute to the rise of [issue].
On balance, understanding the causes of [issue] is the first step towards reducing its effects.
Taking everything into account, [cause] remains the most influential factor behind [effect].

introduction.label: Introduction (Section A)
introduction.purpose: Introduce topic and state your opinion
phrases: Nowadays/These days, the issue of [topic] has become a subject of widespread discussion.
It is widely believed that [topic] plays a crucial role in shaping our modern world.
There is no doubt that [topic] has had a major influence on our lives.
Many people today hold the view that [topic] is beneficial, while others take a different stance.
It is often argued that [topic] contributes positively to society.
In recent years, [topic] has attracted increasing attention from both the public and experts.
Few would dispute that [topic] has become a significant aspect of contemporary life.

arguments.label: Arguments (Section A)
phrases: I firmly believe that [topic] plays an essential role in...
• I strongly agree that [topic] contributes positively to...
• In my opinion, [topic] is one of the most effective ways to...
From my perspective, [topic] should be considered a vital part of...
• Personally, I am convinced that [topic] has brought significant benefits to...
• I tend to believe that [topic] offers clear advantages in terms of...
There is no doubt in my mind that [topic] is beneficial for...
• I am of the opinion that [topic] represents a positive development in...
• It seems to me that [topic] has improved [aspect] considerably.

counter_arguments.label: Arguments (Section B - Counter perspective)
counter_arguments.purpose: Acknowledge other viewpoints while reinforcing your opinion
phrases: In my opinion, [topic] has more positive than negative aspects.
From my perspective, [topic] plays a vital role in modern society and should be supported.
I firmly believe that [topic] is beneficial and contributes greatly to [area].
Personally, I am convinced that [topic] has a largely positive impact

conclusion.label: Conclusion
phrases: In conclusion, I strongly believe that [topic] has brought about positive change.
To sum up, in my view it is that [topic] plays a crucial role in improving [area].
Overall, I am convinced that the advantages of [topic] far outweigh any drawbacks.
On balance, it seems clear that [topic] deserves full support.

introduction.label: Introduction (Section A)
introduction.purpose: Identify the trend and its current state
phrases: Nowadays/These days, society is witnessing a remarkable change in [area/topic].
Over the past few years, there has been a growing trend towards [trend].
It is increasingly common to see [trend] becoming a normal part of life.
In recent times, attitudes towards [topic] have shifted significantly.
There is a noticeable movement in society towards [trend].
It is widely observed that [group/people] are becoming more interested in [trend].
Recent developments suggest that [trend] will continue to expand in the near future.

arguments.label: Arguments (Section A - Trend Analysis)
phrases: It is likely that [trend] will continue to grow in the coming years.
• It is expected that [trend] will become even more widespread.
• In all likelihood, [trend] will remain a dominant feature...
If current patterns persist, [future result] can be expected.
• Should this trend continue, it could lead to [effect].
• Unless major changes occur, [trend] will probably intensify.
The long-term consequences of this trend may include [outcome].
• As this trend develops further, we may begin to see [effect].
• In the future, [trend] could significantly influence [area/behaviour].

speculation.label: Arguments (Section B - Future Implications)
phrases: Hence, this essay will explore the main reasons behind this trend and its possible future implications.
Therefore, it is important to examine what has led to this change and how it might develop further.
Consequently, this essay will discuss the factors contributing to [trend] and consider what the future may hold.
Thus, the following paragraphs will analyse the causes of this growing tendency and its likely effects.

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Make predictions about the trend's trajectory
phrases: In conclusion, the growing trend towards [topic] is likely to shape the future of [area].
To sum up, the evidence suggests that [trend] will continue to expand in importance.
Overall, it seems clear that social and technological changes are driving this development.
On balance, this trend reflects deeper transformations within modern society.
